intro: Cnicus giganteus, commonly known as the giant sowthistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its large, lobed leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in the summer months. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this plant is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. It has a taproot system and can grow up to 1.5 meters in height. The plant is considered an invasive species in some regions due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
